content: crochet a pair of beautiful vintage-style lacy boot cuffs that fit in any time of year this pattern comes in 3 styles and is easily adjustable to fit any leg circumference ***this crochet pattern is available for free on my website or you can download it here as a print-optimized ad-free pdf for your convenience *** **difficulty ** intermediate **materials needed ** 350-750 yds #10 aunt lydia s crochet thread in natural olive golden yellow or color of your choice 15-30 yds #10 aunt lydia s crochet thread in fudge brown or natural for accent colorwork 1 5mm steel hook yarn needle scissors tape measure optional flower spacer bead strands optional rope edge bead caps optional beads for ends of cord ties optional scalloped bead cones optional stitch markers **stitches used ** chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet fpdc = front post double_crochet fptr = front post treble_crochet 2dc cluster = decrease in same stitch 3dc cluster = dc3tog in same stitch 5dc cluster = dc5tog in same stitch 3tr cluster = tr3tog in same stitch decrease = single_crochet 2 together **additional terms ** picot = chain 2 slip_stitch back into first chain v_stitch = double_crochet chain 1 double_crochet in same stitch half_double_crochet in the 3rd loop = look at the top of the stitch and locate the sideways v bend the stitch to look at the back* and you should see another v you ll be working into the back loop of that v this is called the 3rd loop back bar of single_crochet instructions look at the back of the stitch and locate the short bar that runs horizontal work all stitches for that section into this bar fpdtr = front post double treble_crochet wrap working yarn around hook 3 times pull through 2 loops 4 times st/sts = stitch/stitches space/sps = space/spaces prev = previous skip = skip **measurements ** half the circumference of your calf by 6 tall without lace or 7 tall with lace gauge gauge is not particularly important since these will be made to your calf circumference **pattern notes ** -chain 1 at beginning of round does not count as a stitch -chain 4 at beginning of round counts as double_crochet+1 -see pattern for additional notes
